author r2 chain 2 double_crochet in next st and in each single_crochet from prev row when you reach your first single_crochet do not join instead half_double_crochet into top of chain 2 24 sts ***note at this point it s going to look like you re trying to make a bottomless bowl and will curl upward don t worry this is normal and will start flattening out once you start adding more row there s also a small gap from where you start the continuous rounds this will be barely visible later r3 place a stitch marker into the last double_crochet you made we will be working in a continuous round from here double_crochet into same st and 1 double_crochet in next st *2 double_crochet in next st 1 double_crochet in next repeat until you reach your stitch marker do not join remove stitch marker 36 sts r4 2 double_crochet in next st replace stitch marker into first double_crochet *double_crochet in next 2 sts 2 double_crochet in next* repeat until you reach your stitch marker do not join remove stitch marker 48 sts r5 2 double_crochet in next st replace stitch marker into first double_crochet *double_crochet in next 3 sts 2 double_crochet in next* repeat this sequence 4 times partial circle should measure 6 25 inches double_crochet in each st until you reach your stitch marker do not join leave stitch marker and continue to next row 53 sts page 4 copyright© 2016 debra brannon of trinity diameter before you start seeing the actual hat shape should be 7 7 5 inches teens 6 5 6 7 child 6 25 6 5 here we begin to shape the hat downward with continuous row r6 double_crochet into the st with the st marker take it out for a moment because it will probably fight your hook you can replace the marker or leave it out from this point on you will not really need to keep track of st count your
